ai.summary: London LOOP Section 2 is a challenging 28.4 km stretch that traverses ridges around the outer edges of the city, offering a strenuous day for experienced hikers. The route combines ridge-top sections, uneven trails, patches of woodland, and occasional urban connectors, with significant elevation gain and exposed viewpoints.
ai.terrain_summary: Ridge trails with uneven, rocky and grassy sections; exposed high points; a mix of woodlands, heathland, and occasional gravel or tarmac segments. Expect substantial elevation changes, potential boggy areas after rain, and clear horizon views on open ridges.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard, long hike with exposed sections. Check the weather forecast and be prepared for wind and temperature changes on ridges. Wear sturdy boots and bring layered clothing, a map and compass (or GPS), and a fully charged phone. Carry enough water (2–3 L) and high-energy food, plus a small first aid kit, headlamp, whistle, and an emergency blanket. Stay on marked paths, be cautious at road crossings, and share your plan with someone. If visibility is poor or conditions are unsafe, consider postponing or shortening the route.
recommended_gear: Map and compass (or GPS) and a charged phone
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Navigation tools and a basic emergency plan
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) to maximize daylight and trail conditions; winter hikes are possible with careful preparation and shorter daylight hours, but can be more challenging and hazardous.
